free_txt: Complied by Wu Zhendong.
On. SAMPLE: 30-Zn-67 -> 30-ZN-67

bib_record.title: Cross-section measurement for the 67Zn(n,a)64Ni reaction at 6.0 MeV

free_txt: 4.5 MV Van de Graaff
The final cross-section was already corrected for the
attenuation of the neutron flux through the 2 mm
thick stainless wall of the ionization chamber using
the total neutron cross-section of 56Fe in the
ENFD/B-VII.0 library.
A twin gridded ionization chamber composed of
two symmetric sections with a common cathod was used
as charged-particle detector.
The shape of the chamber is cylindrical, with diameter
28.2 cm and height 27.2 cm, and the thickness of the
stainless-steel wall is 2.0 mm.
The chamber has one cathode, two grids, two anodes and
two shields.
The shape of the electrodes is rectangular.
The cathode and the anode are aluminum boards coated
with tungsten layer, and the grid was composed of
parallel tungsten wires coated  with gold 0.10 mm in
diameter and 2.0 mm in spacing.
The distances from the cathode to the grid, the grid
to the anode, and the anode to the shield were 44.0,
22.0 and 11.0 mm respectively.
The working gas was Kr+2.89%CO2 and the pressure was
The high voltages for the cathode, the grids and the
anodes were -2000, 0 and +1600 V, respectively.
A small parallel plate 238U fission chamber
placed between the gridded ionization chamber and the
gas target was used for absolute neutron flux
determination.
The abundance of the 238U isotope was better than
The diameter and mass of the 238U sample were 2.0 cm
and 547.2 (1+-1.3%) ug, respectively.
The working gas of the fission chamber was a flowing
Ar+3.73%CO2 gas with pressure slightly higher than
1.0 atm.
A BF3 long counter was used as a neutron flux
monitor.
Total uncertainty of cross sections     (15%)
alpha events Na                         (14%)
neutron flux density ratio K             (3%)
fission constant Nf                      (2%)
the number of the 67Zn atoms in sample (1.5%)
the number of the U238 atoms in sample (1.3%)
238U(n,f) cross-section              (1%)
4.5 MV Van de Graaff
The deuterium gas cell was 2.0 cm in length and
0.9 cm in diameter with 5.0 micron molybdenum film
as window and fresh gold foil as beam stop.
The deuterium gas pressure was 2.9-3.1 atm during
experiment.
The deuteron beam energy before entering the
molybdenum film was 3.26 MeV.
From Monte Carlo simulation the average energy of
deuterons in the gas cell was 2.74 MeV, and the
corresponding energy of produced neutrons was 6.0 MeV.
The neutron source intensity was about 3.3E+8 neutrons
per second.
Two 67Zn samples were back-to-
back as a set.
The mass and the thickness of the forward sample were
9.864 mg and 680 ug/cm2.
The mass and the thickness of the backward sample were
6.818 mg and 470 ug/cm2.
Each sample was vacuum-evaporated on a tantalum
backing of 4.8 cm in diameter and 50 um in thickness.
From text in J,EPJ/A,43,3,2010.
